channel.title: Sound
channel.description:
i recently started to write my own little colorbot (thanks to all the stuff on this forum), just to learn a bit more about java and how everything works.
Now i somehow want to enable the bot to capture the clients audio output (which i think was mentioned in here before) as i'm quite interested in sound processing, and i don't really know how to get started.
I already tried to get the TargetDataLine of the java Mixer through the java sound implementation (javax.sound.sampled.AudioSystem) but can't get it to work.
It would be nice if someone in here had an idea and could point me in the right direction. (Sorry for all the spelling mistakes etc. as English is not my mothertongue)

item.title: Sound
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

now the issue is creating equivalence classes (i’m not even sure if that’s the word i’m looking for; i mean a set of known equations that correspond to an event) for all of the sounds you want to utilize

Read full topic

item.title: Sound
item.dc:creator: @Blubbers Blubbers
item.description:
@Blubbers wrote:

thanks to the last post of this thread http://villavu.com/forum/showthread.php?t=76865 (thanks echo) i finally got on the right track.
you can simply Xboot the DiractAudioDevice(in com.sun.media.sound) and intercept/whatever the write method.

it is even possible to pseudo-mute Runescape in there.

Read full topic

item.title: Sound
item.dc:creator: @Echo3 Echo_
item.description:
@Echo3 wrote:

marluxia:

Oh ok :). This stuff sounds pretty interesting. I remember someone (who?) has suggested something like this before in previous threads. Has anyone actually done it, and was it feasible?

There was a SCAR plugin for sound detection at one point, idk how effective it was.
This idea has been tossed around at SRL as well:
http://villavu.com/forum/showthread.php?t=76865

Read full topic

item.title: Sound
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

marluxia ambiance is the sound of the surrounding area, this can be turned off though. The sound settings in-game can be set so that only sound actions are played.

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: Sound
item.dc:creator: @Blubbers Blubbers
item.description:
@Blubbers wrote:

After some research i found out that it is possible to capture the soundoutput of the soundcard via native code. This is very system and hardware specific, so i wouldn’t suggest that.
Another option would be intercepting the waveIn/waveOut calls of the applicitation (in this case the JVM) via C++/C# which also is very system specific.
The sound analysis in both options should best be done in native code, but it think it’s just not worth the effort because it is not very portable.

Read full topic

item.title: Sound
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“yo123, post:1, topic:437422”][quote author=Fsig link=topic=538211.msg3937740#msg3937740 date=1331166810]
Why do you need to capture the sound :S?
[/quote]extremely useful. for example, the presence or absence of the chopping sound would tell you if your chopping or not[/quote]
not quite you forget jagex added ambiance

Read full topic

item.title: Sound
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Research applications that are able to intercept and record streaming audio and, given they are open source, look at how they do it. Chances are, you will have to work with native code in order to get something like this to work (or, in the very least, find a Java library with the bindings already created to do it).

Read full topic
